summary: PRRS is characterized by reproductive failure in sows and respiratory disease in pigs of all ages. the annual loss associated with PRRS is approximately 664 million USD. PRRS is a member of the Arteriviridae virus family in the order Nidovirales. antiviral therapeutics could be an alternative or additional control measure to combat these viral infections when a successful vaccine matches the circulating virus is not available. however, no such effective drugs are commercially available to prevent PRRSV infection. Compound 2 was quantitatively obtained from the reaction of 2,4,6-trihydroacetophenone (1) with dimethyl sulfate in the presence of potassium carbonate in acetone. the corresponding acetophenone 2 was then subjected to the Claisen–Schmidt condensation reaction with 1-naphthaldehyde (3) in the presence of potassium hydroxide in methanol. the highest concentration (0.06 mM) caused the complete suppression of VR2332 replication. the highest concentration (0.06 mM) caused the complete suppression of VR2332 replication. the highest concentration (0.06 mM) caused the complete suppression of VR2332 replication. serum viremia measured in pig serum from each group at 0 (before challenge), 7, 14, and 28 dpc by real-time reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR) one pig (1, 4 or 7) in each group was challenged with VR2332 and maintained in the group with the other two unchallenged pigs. pig challenged with VR2332 had a peak viral titer of 104.18 TCID50/mL at 7 dpc. the viral titer gradually decreased to 100.93 TCID50/mL at 28 dpc. the other unchallenged pig (6) did not show viremia at up to 7 dpc. pigs in group 1 (NC) showed an average peak viremia titer of 104.67 TCID50/mL at 7 dpc, which gradually decreased to 101.54 TCID50/mL at 28 dpc. pigs in group 2 (DiNap at 0.04 mM) and 3 (DiNap at 0.2 mM) had average titers of 102.47 TCID50/mL all 3 pigs (1 to 3) in group 1 (NC) became seropositive at 14 dpc. in group 2, two pigs became seropositive at 14 dpc. the other unchallenged pig (6) in the same group became seropositive at 21 dpc. the average daily weight gain (ADWG) was measured for all pigs in each group up to 28 dpc. diNap significantly enhanced the ADWG for both treatment groups. ADWG was calculated for the pigs in each group at 28 days. the pigs in groups 2 and 3 exhibited average virus titers of 103.28 TCID50/mL and 102.68 TCID50/mL, respectively. in group 1, the pig (1) challenged with VR2332 had a virus titer of 104.84 TCID50/mL in its lung tissue. in group 2, the pig (4) challenged with the virus had a virus titer of 102.10 TCID50/ viral RNA was extracted from the lung, and viral loads in the lung tissues were quantified by qRT-PCR. the viral loads were measured and expressed as TCID50/mL equivalents based on the standard curve of the Ct number plotted against Laboratories, AG, Berne, Switzerland) an S/P ratio (ratio between the net optical density of the test samples and the net optical density of the positive control) was considered positive for the PRRSV antibody. primer and probe sequences were as follows: forward primer TGTCAGATTCAGGGAGRATAAGTTAC; probe 6-FAM TGTGGAGTTYAGTYTGCC; and reverse primer ATCARGCGCACAGTRTGATGC. one-step qRT-PCR (qRT-PCR) kit was used to measure viral loads in serum and lung tissues. used to calculate the amount of PRRSV in each sample by converting the Ct value to the TCID50/mL equivalent. repeated measures analysis of variance was used to analyze the significance of differences among groups for ADWG, lung lesions (gross and microscopic) and viral loads in lung tissues. the chemical shifts are reported in parts per million. the deuterium lock signal of the sample solvent was used as a reference. the coupling constants (J) are given in hertz (Hz) purity of all tested compounds was confirmed to be higher than water, dried over Na2SO4, concentrated under reduced pressure. DiNap was dissolved in dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO) at a stock concentration of 20 mM. sterile-filtered using a 0.20-m syringe filter. aliquoted and stored at 4 °C until use. a mixture of 2′,4′,6′-trihydroacetophenone hydrate (2.0 g, 11.89 mmol), potassium carbonate (3.62 g, 26.17 mmol) and dimethylsulfate (2.32 mL, 24.38 mmol) was stirred under argon at 66 °C for 2 h. a mixture of compound 2 (0.2 g, 1.02 mmol), 1-naphthaldehyde (0.14 mL, 1.02 mmol) and potassium hydroxide (1 g) in methanol (20 mL) was stirred at 50 °C for 3 days. the organic layer was washed three times with water, dried over Na2SO4, concentrated under reduced pressure. a stock concentration of 20 mM, sterile-filtered using a 0.20-m syringe filter, aliquoted and stored at 4 °C until use. a prototype strain of type 2 PRRSV was used in the present study. MARC-145 and PAMs were used for virus propagation. cell culture supernatants were collected every 24 h, centrifuged, and stored at 80 °C until analysis. the progeny virus titers were measured using a microtitration infectivity assay. the virus titers are expressed as TCID50/mL. pigs in group 2 and group 3 were injected with 0.32 mM (0.04 mM/kg body weight) and 1.6 mM (0.2 mM/kg body weight) on day 0, one pig was challenged with VR2332 at a titer of 103/mL TCID50. all 3 pigs in group 1 constituted the nontreated challenged control (NC) group. the treatment with DiNap was repeated with the same concentrations at 3 dpc. the pigs were weighed at 0 (before challenge) and 28 dpc. the scoring of the microscopic lesions was performed according to a scale from 0 to 3 depending on the degree of inflammation. 0 indicated no lesions, 1 indicated mild interstitial pneumonia, 2 indicated moderate/multifocal interstitial pneumonia, and 3 indicated severe intense/diffuse interstitial pneumonia. total of 25 L containing 5 L of template RNA, 12.5 L of 2 RT-PCR buffer, 0.5 L of each forward and reverse primer (20 pmol, at a final concentration of 0.8 pmol), 0.5 L of RNAse inhibitor (40 U/L; RiboLockTM, Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc., Germany), 1 L of 25X RT-PCR enzyme mix, and 4.8 L of nuclease-free water. 0 indicated no lesions, 1 indicated mild interstitial pneumonia, 2 indicated moderate/multifocal interstitial pneumonia, and 3 indicated severe intense/diffuse interstitial pneumonia. the viral loads in the serum and tissues were quantified by real-time reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR) using a TaqMan® assay. step qRT-PCR was performed in a total of 25 L containing 5 L of template RNA, 12.5 L of 2 RT-PCR buffer, 0.5 L of each forward and reverse primer (20 pmol, at a final concentration of 0.8 pmol), 0.2 L of the TaqMan® probes (25 pmol, at a final concentration of 0.8 pmol), 0.5 L of RNAse inhibitor (40 U/L; RiboLockTM, The statistical analysis was performed using SPSS Advanced Statistics 17.0 software (SPSS, Inc., Chicago, IL, USA).
